name: Mercury
bio: The smallest and innermost planet in the solar system. Named after the fastest god in Roman mythology.

facts.title: Surface Temperature
facts.content: Can reach 800°F (430°C) during the day and -290°F (-180°C) at night

name: Venus
bio: Earth's closest planetary neighbor and similar in structure and size, Venus is sometimes called Earth's evil twin. Venus is the third brightest object in the sky after the Sun and Moon, and spins slowly in the opposite direction from most planets.

facts.title: Surface Temperature
facts.content: Temperatures range from 86 to 158 Fahrenheit (30 to 70 Celsius), hot enough to melt lead, making it the hottest planet in our solar system.

name: Earth
bio: The only planet in our solar system with life, you probably live here too.

facts.title: Surface Temperature
facts.content: Ranges from 14 °C at the surface to 5,400 °C in the inner core

name: Mars
bio: Frequently called the "Red Planet" because iron minerals in the Martian dirt oxidize, or rust, causing the surface to look red.

facts.title: Surface Temperature
facts.content: Ranges from 14 °C at the surface to 5,400 °C in the inner core

name: Jupiter
bio: The largest planet in the solar system, named after the king of the gods in Roman mythology.

facts.title: Surface Temperature
facts.content: Between -110 °C and -160 °C depending on altitude and latitude

name: Saturn
bio: Made mostly of hydrogen and helium and having the most spectacular rings. Saturn is a rich source of scientific discovery and still holds many mysteries.

name: Uranus
bio: The ice giant surrounded by 13 faint rings and 28 small moons. Uranus appears to spin sideways, rotating at a nearly 90-degree angle from the plane of its orbit.

name: Neptune
bio: The only planet in our solar system not visible to the naked eye. Neptune is roughly 900 times less sunlight than Earth.
